sentences: Lene Marlin (born Lene Marlin Pedersen, 17 August 1980) is a Norwegian musician, singer and songwriter.
Playing My Game (1998–2002) =
She made her Norwegian recording debut on 12 October 1998, with the single "Unforgivable Sinner", a number one hit for eight weeks.
She won an MTV Europe award in 1999.
Her song "Sitting Down Here" became a top-5 hit in the UK Singles Chart, and reached number 5 in the Netherlands in 2000.
Another Day (2003–2004)
Marlin's second album, Another Day, was released on 22 September 2003.
Lost in a Moment (2005–2007)
In June 2005, Marlin released her third album, Lost in a Moment.
The first single from that album, "How Would It Be", was released in Europe in May 2005, and made the Top 20 in both Norway and Italy Singles chart.
Despite being less well known in other parts of the world, Marlin made a trip to Taiwan and China during October 2005 to promote a Taiwanese version of Lost in a Moment.
Twist the Truth (2008–present)

In July 2008, the Norwegian press announced that Marlin was in the studio recording her fourth album with Norwegian artists and songwriters Even "Magnet" Johansen and Børge Fjordheim at Askøy, Grand Sports and Malabar Studios.
"Twist The Truth", her fourth album, was released on 30 March 2009.
The first single, "Here We Are", was number one on the Norwegian National Radio Chart for two weeks, and was the most airplayed Norwegian song of 2009.
She also co-wrote "Yesterday's Gone" with Frida Amundsen, which was featured on Amundsen's 2012 debut album, September Blue.
In 2006, she performed with Swiss band, Lovebugs on their single "Avalon", which made the Top 10 in the Swiss chart as well as topping the Swiss National Airplay Chart.
In 2009, Marlin was featured on Aleksander Denstad
In 2011, she worked with Gary Louris, Autumn Rowe, Mads Langer, and Tobias Stenkjaer.
In 2013, Marlin participated in the reality show Hver gang vi møtes on TV2.

In September 2014, Marlin wrote an essay for Norway's largest newspaper Aftenposten in which she candidly described her lifelong struggles with depression and a suicide attempt due to the pressures of work and fame.
In June 2020, Marlin announced her pregnancy on Instagram with her partner, Kåre Conradi.

Marlin has won four awards: Best Pop Solo Artist, Best Single ("Sitting Down Here"), Best Newcomer and the 1999 Artist Of The Year at the Spellemannprisen, the Norwegian equivalent to the Grammy awards, as well as the MTV Europe award for Best Nordic Act, presented in Dublin, Ireland in November 1999.

Marlin has won four awards: Best Pop Solo Artist, Best Single ("Sitting Down Here"), Best Newcomer and the 1999 Artist Of The Year at the Spellemannprisen, the Norwegian equivalent to the Grammy awards, as well as the MTV Europe award for Best Nordic Act, presented in Dublin, Ireland in November 1999.
Marlin was also nominated for Best International Breakthrough Act at the 2001 BRIT Awards, alongside P!nk, Jill Scott, Westlife and Kelis, losing to Kelis.
Playing My Game (1999)
Another Day (2003)
Lost in a Moment (2005)
Twist the Truth (2009)
She made her Norwegian recording debut on 12 October 1998, with the single "Unforgivable Sinner", a number one hit for eight weeks.
Another Day (2003–2004)
Marlin's second album, Another Day, was released on 22 September 2003.
Two singles were released: "You Weren't There" and "Another Day".
"You Weren't There" debuted at No. 1 on Norway Singles Top 20 and remained on the chart for 11 weeks.
It also stayed for 24 weeks in Italy Singles Top 50 chart, peaking at No. 1.
The single "Another Day" was released in Italy and Norway only, and peaked at No. 17 on the Italian Singles chart.
Lost in a Moment (2005–2007)
In June 2005, Marlin released her third album, Lost in a Moment.
This single also appeared briefly for a week at a low spot in Germany Singles Top 100.
Despite being less well known in other parts of the world, Marlin made a trip to Taiwan and China during October 2005 to promote a Taiwanese version of Lost in a Moment.
Her record company claims that Lost in a Moment was their best selling western record of the year.
The first single, "Here We Are", was number one on the Norwegian National Radio Chart for two weeks, and was the most airplayed Norwegian song of 2009.
She also co-wrote "Yesterday's Gone" with Frida Amundsen, which was featured on Amundsen's 2012 debut album, September Blue.
In 2011, she worked with Gary Louris, Autumn Rowe, Mads Langer, and Tobias Stenkjaer.
They welcomed a little girl to the world in October.

Marlin has won four awards: Best Pop Solo Artist, Best Single ("Sitting Down Here"), Best Newcomer and the 1999 Artist Of The Year at the Spellemannprisen, the Norwegian equivalent to the Grammy awards, as well as the MTV Europe award for Best Nordic Act, presented in Dublin, Ireland in November 1999.
